text: The white sun beats down on the rocky terrain. There's no cloud in the blue sky and the wind is at a standstill. Far in the distance, a MEDIUM SIZED FLAT-BED TRUCK makes way to the entrance of a large cavern opening. Two VULTUR perched on a barren tree watch the intruders.

The truck screeches to a dusty stop. Three men in matchin coveralls and hard hats jump from the cab: CHIEF (42, sto weary), LANKY (32, withered) and COLLEGE BOY (23, clean c and naive). Chief holds a map and glares into the howling black mouth before them.
This is it.
Why did it have to be these caves...
Is something wrong?
(to College Boy) Don't mind me, buddy. It's nothin'.
Chief grabs a flashlight and moves to the back of the tru The logo on the rear gate reads "WIGWAM WASTE MANAGEMENT.
Let's get that first barrel.
The gate drops revealing their full load of YELLOW BARREL bearing the familiar BIOHAZARD WASTE symbol.
College Boy and Lanky steer a cart loaded with the first  barrel inside. Chief's lone beam of light leads the men.
What's with the awkward silence?
You don't know?
College Boy shakes his head "no" and they set the cart do

Last winter, a man kidnapped a little  girl and holed up in one of these  caves. The cops had him pinned down  and began to move in. This guy started  shooting... but he wasn't aiming at  the officers... (getting closer) ...he was firing at something inside.
College Boy is rapt.
When the dust cleared, all they found  was the little girl's shoes. (beat) With the feet still in 'em.
Something GRABS College Boy's ankles, causing him to jump
Ahh!!!
Lanky's on his knees, having grabbed him from behind. The two men mockingly laugh. College boy settles, embarrassed
Assholes.
Hey, relax, I nearly shit myself  when my boss pulled that one on me.
I went well beyond nearly.
Then, a sound. All eyes turn.
What was that?
Once was plenty, fellas.
Shhhh...

As Chief moves forward, pulling out his pick-axe. Instantly, the cave is illuminated by a white floodlight. group of GREENPEACE HIPPIE ACTIVISTS stand in the cave,  CHAINED TOGETHER at the waist, startling the men into scr MEAN GREEN (35, crooked glasses on a face that has launch a thousand craps) barks into a MINI BULLHORN that hangs a her neck. She charges towards Chief.
Stop it right there! You will not  rape Mother Nature one more day!
Panicked, Chief drops his pick-axe and stumbles back.
Whoa! Whoa! Whoa!
In unison, the hippies start CHANTING.
Mother Nature is not a whore/Don't  dump in her any-more/Mother Nature  is not a whore/Don't dump in her any- more...
A BEARDED CAMERAMAN with a huge KEY RING on his belt, fil the whole event. The three men are stopped in their track
Take it easy! We have a permit!

(handing a document) And we have an injunction from the  State to prevent any dumping in these  caverns! This is virgin land! The  aqueducts in these caves bring  drinking water to our families, and  its piping provides drainage for our  farms that enrich this barren land!  And it won't be tainted by waste of  any kind! Not now! Not ever!
Chief, shaken, confirms the injunction and hands it back.
Fine, just back off!
He snaps his fingers, motioning to the barrel.
Let's roll... Now-now-now!
Backing away, looking to Mean Green.
How do you guys always know where  we're going?
(with a smirk) I'll tell ya next time! NOW MOVE IT!
Hastily, the men roll the barrel out of the cave.
Score one for the green team!!!
The hippies let out a spirited cheer. One pulls out a  tambourine, drums the beat for KUM BI YA. The rest join i the victorious chant as they watch the three men hop in t truck and peel away.
Hey, man, that was righteous, but I  need a shot with the sign up.
At the end of the human chain, an earthy woman, FUZZY, mo to hang a GREENPEACE sign. Mean Green strokes the cave wa
We saved you today, ol' gal.
Fuzzy hammers the sign in, but hits too hard, causing a b in the rock wall.
Oh, fuck!
Sister, why do you always swing for  the fences?
(eyeing breach) It's okay, but I... I think I see  something in there... something shiny.
Fuzzy puts her face up to the hole for a closer look. The rest of the hippie-chain moves in closer.
Oh my, it looks like diamonds!

CHOMP! A set of giant, ravenous teeth bite into Fuzzy's s Blood SPLATTERS on the hippies. Bearded Cameraman jumps to pull Fuzzy from the breach. Fuzzy's body is YANKED into the hole. The group tumbles  forward. Mean Green tries to stop herself from sliding, but can't. One by one, the hippies are being dragged to their death. Ripping, tearing, and howling echoes off the walls. Bearded Cameraman stumbles back. Mean Green spots him.
Give me the keys!!!

Bearded Camerman just stares at her in shock. He's missin both his arms. Mean Green lunges and grabs Chief's dropped pick-axe. She HAMMERS at the chain around her waist. Foot by foot, she's dragged closer. At the last second, s BREAKS the chain, popping herself free. She spins, running for safety. A guttural HOWL behind her fills the cavern. Mean Green sprints toward the cave open She's gonna make it. Only a few more feet. And then... JE Something grabs her neck and YANKS her back into the dark The whiplash sends her bloody BULLHORN flying into the li As it lands, it lets out one last weak HONK...
The title SHATTERS...
P.O.V. - We frantically EMERGE from the burning wreck...  RUN from the crash over desolate prairie land...

Neon light flashes UNITED NATIONS TAVERN. Laughing and mu emanates. Besides the bar, there's nothing around for mil A 1985, pristine black Pontiac Trans-Am with a Golden Eag on the hood pulls up. The rear bumper sticker reads "MY O
A weasel-like man with a fat belly and tank-top emerges f the hot rod carrying a VELVET POOL CUE CASE. Freeze on hi
The rest of the parking lot is scattered with cars and pi trucks. Bozo lazily makes his way to the bar and pushes  through the front entrance --
Bozo passes a man dressed in a cheap suit and standing we over six foot five with frazzled black hair and olive ski Talking with a thick Greek accent, he pleads into a pay p

(into pay phone) They took my laptop with my PowerPoint  presentation, my Blackberry, my  cell... And to top it off, my car  crapped out on the side of the road!  I'm not making the conference and I  have fourteen leads waiting for me.  You gotta help me out here. I'm not  kidding, I've have fourteen PRIMO  leads waiting in the lobby of the  Mariott... MARIOTT...
Freeze on him.
CLICK. The pay phone goes dead.
Son of a -- (deep breath, soothing) In with anger, out with love.
Further into the bar, a man in a wheelchair loads a quart into an old jukebox, but he is instantly pushed away by B Freeze on him.
Bozo's tank-top reads, "ONLY COOL CHICKS CAN DO ME."
(rolling away) Hey...
Shut up, fag.
Bozo punches in his selection. EDGY CAT (34, samurai pony tail, don't you dare call him an alcoholic) stands by the bar's POOL TABLE powdering his cue.
(to Bozo) You're late!
Don't dilly-dally then. Rack 'em!
The CD spins and an 1980s heavy metal classic KICKS IN. Bozo, mouthing the lyrics, struts away. NOTE: Music plays over all the bar sequences.
P.O.V. - We continue to run. Rapid breathing.
Beer Guy (kinda handsome... just kinda) sets a keg of bee behind the bar. Freeze on him.
He talks with BARTENDER (thinning hair, chiseled face, bi earring) who preps a drink.

I mean, we'd been together for so  long and then... bang! She drops me.  Since then, it's been like a damn  country song: she's gone, the car's  repossessed, and a father figure  made a pass at me. I'm not saying I  ever had it. But I have definitely  lost it. (beat) Now I haul this swill from armpit to  armpit. I used to be a model for  Christ's sake.
Coach has been eavesdropping on Beer Guy and approaches.
For what, may I ask?
JC Penny. Spring wear.
Beer Guy then mimics throwing a sport coat over his shoul and delivering his "model" cheese smile.
You know, Chach, catching you at  this low point is pure serendipity.
Why is that?

Because I take the rubble of man and  build superstars. In my briefcase  here is a doorway to a self-help  sensation. Give me a minute, because  I'd like to buy you a drink and change  your life forever. I have a brochure --
Save it. We don't deal in pamphlets  'round here. We stick to chemistry.  And his drinks are on me.
Bartender puts a shot in front of Beer Guy. Behind him, a mounted DEER HEAD is prominently displayed. Freeze on him
With Coach stumped, Bartender turns to Beer Guy.
Was that the last keg?
Yup, one keg of Beast for the  basement, then the truck's dry.
If you're stayin', move the truck,  boss gets pissed about you using  primo parking.
Beer Guy downs his shot and hoists the lone keg into the  waiting keg elevator.
Right, 'cause this joint's hopping.
He hits a button and the keg slowly lowers to the basemen
P.O.V. - We jump over a bush and crash in the dusty earth
A glass of beer slides down the bar. A hand GRABS it and  puts it on a tray. The woman is pretty though haggard, st apron and dirty blond hair. Freeze on her.

head_text.subj: DUMPING OF MANURE... IN EX-HUSBAND'S CAR

text: Tuffy carries the tray toward a table. She passes a TV mo on the wall. ON TV: A NEWSCASTER, dressed in a coat and tie, talks.

...the search for the missing  protesters will be further complicated  by the unstable conditions of these  deep tunnels. Thus far, no sign of  life has been detected, yet town  officials are still optimistic.
Newscaster spins and an ECLIPSE GRAPHIC appears on screen

On a brighter note, or should I say  a darker note, tomorrow's solar  eclipse will bring out adults and  children alike for a citywide fair  of this metrological event. Stay  tuned for our man on the street to  take a closer look...

Beer Guy pulls the keg from the elevator and places it ne to other kegs. A faint conversation brews behind a curtai BOSS MAN (paunchy, sweaty, ugly) and ROADIE (English acce light hair, leather skin, thin build) talk shop.
Listen, bud. I got a load ready to  move and your man's not here.
He's coming. Relax. And if he doesn't  show --
We got a problem.
P.O.V. - We are trucking... labored breathing...
Tuffy moves to a table where ADULTERER (bushy mustache,  sweater vest, dress shirt) sits with TRAMPY (designer gla hair pulled back, tight blue business suit, closet tramp) Freeze on Trampy.
He said there was no reason I had to  stay a teller and that if I did good  work and didn't mess up, I could  become an assistant manager within  three years. (pause) Can you believe that?
That sounds great.
Freeze on him.
Adulterer reaches into his pocket to pay the tab, but he  inadvertently pulls out his hidden WEDDING RING.
That sounds like bullshit! I could  be an assistant manager at The Lake  Arrowhead Casino for knowing the  fuckin' alphabet to G! I'll be twenty  in three months...

The damning wedding band falls and bounces. As it rolls,  Tuffy, Trampy and Adulterer watch. The ring stops, standing still on its side. Trampy seethes as she chooses which obscenity to deliver. Adulterer slides a wad of cash to Tuffy.
Just bring the whole bottle.
P.O.V. - Sprinting and wheezing. The bar lights are ahead
Tuffy walks back over to the bar adding Adulterer's cash a fat roll of money. BELLE (stringy blond hair, cute face brand-spanking new employee) looks up with surprise. Freeze on her.
If I could made that kind of money,  I'd be in Hollywood next week.
Boss Man walks by and nods to Tuffy, making his way to th rickety side-staircase to the SECOND FLOOR. Tuffy grinds teeth and moves to the staircase.
'Round here, there are ways.
Boss Man winks at Belle. Pure sleaze. Freeze on him.
P.O.V. - Running, approaching the distant bar...
Bozo looks grimly at a pile of CASH on the ledge of the p table. Edgy Cat sinks the eighth shot of a NINE BALL game
That cash is gonna look much better  in my pocket.
(re: mounted head) Ya know, that deer only looks scared  when you're in the room.
Para rolls up behind Edgy.
Excuse me, please.
Jesus!
Edgy looks to Para, distracted. Bozo quickly replaces the WHITE CUE BALL with one hidden in his waistline.
P.O.V. - The bar's a quarter mile away.
Para's chair back aims at the pool table pocket of which  Edgy Cat is lining up for the winning shot.
That's all she wrote...
SMACK! The nine ball sinks in the pocket, the cue ball  ricochets away as intended. Para flips a switch under his wheelchair's arm rest. The ball strays ODDLY into the pocket near Para. Scratch.
What?!
Ohhh, now that's a rough one.
That's motherfuckin' impossible!
(crude Oriental accent) Yoh anga will be yoh downfah. Go  again?
Goddamn it! NO!
Oh, come on. Crape Diem!
Bozo takes the cash from the table. Edgy Cat sulks away  cursing to himself and moves to the bar. Roadie looks on, sipping a beer. Freeze on Roadie.
P.O.V. - Still running. The bar is getting closer.
Bozo HITS the table of GRANDPA (elderly, white hair, bush white mustache) and GRANDMA (curly white hair, glasses). Freeze on them.
Wake up! Check your pants!
Get outta here.
(mocking) What's that? Wha'cha say? Huh? (to Grandma) How much for the whole night, Grandma?
You should be so lucky.
(re: his fists) This one will stun ya, but this one  will put ya to sleep.
Whoa!

Bozo approaches OLD VET (52, long hair with bandanna, dir beard) HARLEY MOM, (45, bruiser, grizzled, tough as a sad and DRUNK GUY at the bar. The sad trio toss peanut shells into three nearby tall, fat peanut barrels.
You boys wanna try your luck at the  loot?
Harley mom is offended. Not a word from the others.
Come on, I'll even throw with my  left hand.
He turns in disappointment.
Nothin' but a bunch of butts and  pussies in here!
P.O.V. - The bar is close -- we leap a ditch.
KRASH! Belle DROPS a tray full of drinks behind the bar.
Shit! Shit! Shit!
Don't sweat it, just clean it up  before he's done.
He points up to the second floor.
Tuffy's son CODY (7, innocent, cute) sits on the floor  watching TV. Freeze on him.
Tuffy puts headphones over his ears.
Keep these on, sweetheart.
Mommy, I want Nemo.
Mommy's working on it.
Tuffy kisses him and then moves to an adjacent room.
Tuffy enters the room and takes off her blouse exposing h breasts. She pulls up her skirt and bends over a bedpost.
Let's get this over with.
Boss Man walks up naked, except for red cowboy boots.
I love a woman with enthusiasm.
Bozo walks to the middle of the room.
I got two hundred bucks says none of  you can beat me!
Hey! Get quiet or get out.
C'mon guys --
P.O.V. - Hurtling toward the double doors and --
Gimme some ACTION --
BOOM! The double doors to the bar are kicked open by HERO (30s, rugged alpha man built to kick ass). KRASH! Belle DROPS a second tray of drinks --
Hero is scraped, bruised and bloodied. He is dressed in b denim and holds a RUST-RED SHOTGUN and GUNNY SACK. He SLAMS the double doors shut and props a chair against handles, securing them.
Unless you people want to die you'll  do what I say and you'll do it fast!
Bartender cocks his SHOTGUN.
You hold it right there, mister.
A storm of hell's coming down on  this place any minute!
Drop the canon!
Hero puts down the shotgun and moves towards Bartender.
I'm not armed now, just hear me out.
I'll drop you and not even think  about it!
Let me explain!
You got one second to --
Hero reveals a drool-dripping, white, GRANDPA BEAST HEAD  from the gunny sack and holds it out and for all to see.
Take a good look and listen to me!  There's at least a four of these  things out there!
Grandpa Beast's head has large red eyeballs and a mouth f of jagged, ivory white teeth. It is like an albino jackal head with spiked hair.

I saw one of them tear up five men  like they were corn on the cob! (off silence, shock) I don't know what they are. I don't  know where they came from. All I do  know is that these fuckers are fast,  nasty, and hungry.
The bar stares at him, slack-jawed.
And they can fly. Not to mention  they got claws like Ginsu knifes and  more teeth than a chainsaw.
The Bartender lowers his shotgun slightly. Fast as a snak Hero GRABS it. He notices the engraving, "THE JUDGE."

They're like goddamn blood hungry  biker tattoos come to life. They're  clocking us. Right now. And we have  to lock this bar down! (moving around) That means doors, windows, drains,  and basements. We have to do it fast!
Hero looks out the lone front window.
(looks to Belle) You! Get on that phone. Call the  cops, National Guard, townies, whoever  kicks ass and get 'em out here.
Belle moves to a pay phone at the end of the bar.
Any questions?
Who are you?
I'm the hero --
CRASH! A white Beast arms BURSTS through the window and S Hero right down the middle. The Judge FIRES into the ceil
The Judge's blast blows a toe off Boss Man's RIGHT FOOT a he reaches climax with Tuffy. Boss Man HOLLERS.

Hero's right half is JERKED outside through the window. Blood sprays. Rapid chomping. CRASH! The double doors are kicked open, splintering the propped up chair. HEROINE (Native American, rugged, ripped pants, wickedly  hot) rushes in, slams the doors shut and instinctively ki up the RUST RED SHOTGUN. She flips it sideways and slides the metal weapon through the handles of the double doors, securing them. BAM! A massive HIT slams into the doors from the outside  sending Heroine SLIDING across the floor. She SPRINGS to her feet and drives her weight into a tabl attempting to hoist it over the now open window.
HELP ME! SOMEBODY!
Old Vet and Harley Mom rush to Heroine's aid. They raise table to cover the gaping hole. Heroine looks outside.
GET DOWN!

A BEAST nails the rising table, just missing Heroine's fa The table falls, pinning Heroine. JUNIOR BEAST enters. He's small and too fast to see well. He SWIPES the heads off Old Vet and Harley Mom. Bartender grabs The Judge, but he's SCRATCHED down the back. Junior Beast rips out the pay phone. Knocks over the TV. Yanks out half of Trampy's hair. Edgy Cat CHARGES the spastic monster with a stool.
I got you!

Edgy Cat misses. Junior Beast sends him FLYING into a wal BLAM! BLAM! Bartender FIRES The Judge at the creature hit lights instead. An errant shot destroys Edgy Cat's face. Para covers as Junior Beast RIPS the back of his wheelcha Roadie WHACKS Junior Beast with a chair. Stunned, it flie across the room, landing in a metal ICE COOLER. Bozo SLAMS it closed, capturing Junior Beast.
Got 'cha!
Shadows of THREE SHRIEKING BEASTS close in on the window.

Bartender runs across the bar and SLAMS shut the thick wo shutters. The Beasts HIT, cracking the middle. Roadie power lifts the table with Heroine and braces it  against the window for reinforcement, but a FURRY ARM bus through and grabs the other half of Hero.
Goddamn you!

Blood starts to SPRAY from outside as the rest of Hero is being devoured through the smallish hole. Heroine works a GOLD RING off of Hero's ring finger. The  feeding MOMMA BEAST'S head breaks in through the hole. It grabs Heroine's left forearm. Bartender aims The Judge at the Beast...
You'll hit her!
Roadie KNOCKS The Judge up -- BLAM!
The Judge's shotgun blast blows off another toe on Boss M RIGHT FOOT. He cries out in agony.

Heroine spins and buries a splintered piece of the broken chair into the ATTACKING MOMMA BEAST'S RIGHT EYE. The Bea SCREECHES and jerks back, dragging the rest of Hero outsi Heroine clutches the ring. Shrieks and flapping wings are heard outside. They dissipate. A moment of calm. Belle timidly holds the receiver of the busted pay phone. The other patrons emerge from under tables and other hidi spaces in various states of shock. Junior Beast has  momentarily stopped moving. Bozo secures the lid with a n PADLOCK.
What the FUCK was that?
Wild-eyed and with a trembling hand, Heroine pours hersel shot from the bar. She downs it and takes a long breath.
The jungle has a new king.
Freeze on her.
Pan and scan over various NEWSPAPER HEADINGS with picture and newsreel footage that read:
There is a HOLLER at the top of the stairs. Everyone turn
Is it clear?!
Yeah.
Is there a gun pointing at you?
Nah, I got the gun.
Boss Man hobbles down the stairs with the help of Tuffy. foot is a bloody mess. He is holding a .38.
Alright goddamn it! Who shot me!?  Who did it!?
Belle and Bartender move to his aid.
My goddamn foot is gone! Who fuckin'  shot me? Who fuckin' shot me!?
(motioning to Heroine) Her fella.
My husband...
Well, where's the sonuvabitch!?
He's dead.
What? (noticing destruction) What the hell happened down here?!
Boss Man looks to Bozo.
I didn't do it! It was fuckin'  monsters, asshole!
Jesus Christ on the cross... someone  make sense.
Easy. We're surrounded by something  the likes none of you have ever seen  before. Some kind of animals. Real  fast, volatile, predators. One went  through three of your patrons like  nothing.
So, your dead hubby shot me twice,  three of my customers have been eaten,  and there are angry creatures outside?
He only shot you once.
Huh?
(re: Bartender) He shot you the other time.
It was an accident. Sorry.
Boss Man squints skeptically. Adulterer points to GRANDPA BEAST'S HEAD on the bar.
Look at it!
Fan-fuckin-tastic.
My god... what is that?
That's one piece of four problems.
Please elaborate.

That head over there, that's the  oldest of the bunch, looked like the  Grandpa. We caught the little one,  Junior, in the cooler there. As we've  seen, what he lacks in size he more  than makes up for in speed.
And the rest of 'em?
Unfortunately, the worst of 'em are  still outside.
NOTE: As Heroine describes each beast, we see a slight gl of their virtues, hidden mainly by shadows and fog.
The next one is taller, but all out  of proportion. Like a "teen beast."
TEEN BEAST has a big head and awkward body. He clumsily m and seems uncomfortable in his own skin.
He was spastic, clumsy, but deadly  just the same.
Heroine tends to her scratched arm.
I just took the eye out of the mother.  She calculates, guiding the attacks.

MOMMA BEAST flashes out from the dark. She's shorter than Teen, but much wider. She has a big mouth and NATIONAL  GEOGRAPHIC BOOBS that hang down to her waist. She covers stabbed right eye and SCREECHES.
Heroine taps her right eye.
If you are face to face with her,  dive left.
And the last one is the --
Father. The biggest, the strongest...
A blur of muscles, bloody fur, and teeth.
The entire bar stares at Heroine with their mouths agape.
No sign of any weaknesses. No sign  at all. He's an eating machine.
Of all the friggin' bars to be stuck  in.
That's not it. Four are here, but  there's three others... which I can't  account for.
Heroine eyes the room.
We need to lock this place down. Is  everyone in this room?
Oh my god! My son! My SON!
Tuffy races toward the staircase to the SECOND FLOOR.
Wait!
Tuffy is halfway up the stairs.
Cody! Mommy's coming! Mommy's coming!
Stop her!
Hey!
Tuffy BURSTS through the door. Cody sits by the TV, unmov
Mommy --
Tuffy pulls Cody into her arms. Heroine and Bartender hal to guard the doorway. Heroine spots a SMALL PORTAL WINDOW
Oh sweetheart! What was I thinking?  Mommy is never gonna let you go!
Let's lock off this room.
(moving to exit) Never, ever, never. Never, ever,  never, baby. I love you --
SMASH! Papa Beast BURSTS through the portal window and RI Cody's torso from Tuffy's grasp. Tuffy holds his DANGLING ARMS. Blood sprays everywhere.
NOOOOOOOO!

Papa Beast LUNGES at Tuffy! Bartender SHOOTS, nailing Pap Beast. He hisses, but can't fit through the small window. Bartender aims again for a kill shot, but Papa Beast  projectile vomits Cody's remains at Bartender. Papa Beast retracts out the portal window. Heroine SLAMS wood shutters closed. Tuffy drops Cody's arms. Bug-eyed. She moves, zombie-like to the staircase. Bartender follows, covered in Papa Beas bile. Heroine locks the staircase door shut.
Damn it.
Beer Guy stares at the bile covered Bartender.
Oh god...
He hands him a towel. Tuffy slowly walks towards the rest the patrons. The blood on her face and chest tells them w happened. The horror hits home. Heroine eyes the destroyed phone.
(to Tuffy) Are you --
Heroine puts a hand up to silence Coach.
Just let her be... please. (beat) Is that the only phone?
Bartender emerges from the back holding a mess of plastic and wires.
The back phone is wrecked, too.
Trampy's eyes light up and she digs through her purse.
This is really happening. I can't  believe this is really happening.
Grandpa and Grandma have calmly re-taken their seats.
What'd you say?
I didn't say anything.

Bartender hesitantly tosses a wash towel over the Grandpa Beast head at the end of the bar. Para is awkwardly trying to fix the back of his wheelchai Belle moves over to help and sees a mess of wires coming  from the wheelchair's back rest.
Thank you, but I don't need any help --
What's this? A power magnet or  something?
No. It's nothing.
Belle puts together his scam with a smirk.
I didn't peg you for a con man.
Hey, it pays more than the couch.
Lots of stuff around here does.
Trampy pulls out a CELLULAR PHONE from her purse.
Here!
The group looks over. Adulterer GRABS it.
Hey!
Back off!
Beer Guy walks from behind the bar.
So, what now? Did those things leave?
Why don't you go check it out?
Fuck no.
(into cell phone) I have a signal! I have -- Diane?  Diane listen to me... get the kids  and get in the basement... do it  right now...
Trampy stares with grief in her eyes.
I'll explain later. Not now! I'm at  a bar... look... shut up! JUST SHUT  UP AND GET IN THE FUCKING BASEMENT,  DIANE! Diane! Diane?... Hello? Damn  it! I lost the signal!
Adulterer looks at the phone a bit dazed.
Okay. Okay. Look now, I gotta get  outta here! I gotta go! My wife...  See my wife is alone... She could be  in trouble. I GOTTA GO!
He moves towards the front door. Heroine moves into his p
I wouldn't do that.
Adulterer, violently grabs Heroine to shove her away.
Fuck you, bitch!
Heroine nails Adulterer with THREE HITS to the chin, thro and chest, flipping him to the floor. She pulls a KNIFE f her belt buckle and has it under Adulterer's chin.

You can risk your life, but not mine!  My daughter's no more than twenty  miles from here waiting for me. I  have just as much reason to leave  this place as you do. But I also  know that if they're here, then  they're not there yet.
Adulterer squirms.
You understand me?
Get the fuck off...
You understand me!?
Yes!
Now pull that tough boy shit again  and I'll slice you from neck to nuts!
Adulterer nods obediently. Heroine removes the knife from his neck and plants it back into her buckle.
You can't keep me here. This is  bullshit. Fuckin' bullshit. This is  fucking BULLSHIT!
We can't risk letting them in.
(trembling, pissed) Right.

Adulterer takes his seat. He looks over at the half bald  Trampy. She looks at him, hurt. At the bar, Bozo puts the TV back into place, he jiggles  with some wires in the back, bringing back the picture.
Anything?
Yeah, you got it.
The bar takes notice. Trampy, cell phone in hand, paws th a phone book as she watches the broadcast.
See! This has to be isolated. That's  a local broadcast.
ON TV: The Newscaster reads the teleprompter.
And now, we head to our man on the  scene with a live look at tomorrow's  event in Red Mountain.
Heroine eagerly looks on, moving closer to the TV.
My daughter's in Red Mountain.
ON TV: There is an awkward pause from the Newscaster. The broadcast doesn't cut to the reporter.
Can you hear us? Apparently we're  having some technical difficulties...
Heroine sinks in her skin.
Oh no.
Oh, there we go!
